All Classes

Class
Description
Avatar
This class represents a Player's avatar.
Bullet
This class represents a Bullet.
BulletData
This class tracks the bullet data of the program
Collider
Checks for collisions within the program
DeathScreen
This class represents the screen that appears when the player loses all its health.
GamemodeSelectionScreen
This class represents the screen where the player can select the gamemode (king of the hill or deathmatch).
imageReaderToRGB
 
Instructions
This class represents the Instructions screen that contains instructions on how to play the game.
Knife
This class represents a Knife.
Main
 
MainMenu
This class represents the main menu that manages all the screens and switches the screens based on user input (buttons clicked).
MenuScreen
This class represents the first screen that shows up after joining a room.
Player
This class represents a Player.
PlayerData
The class you store in the datsabase must fit 3 simple constraints: The class must have a default constructor that takes no arguments.
PlayerHUD
This class represents a Player HUD.
PostMatchScreenDeathMatch
This class represents the screen that shows up after a Deathmatch game ends, displaying the scores of each player, as well as who won.
PostMatchScreenKOTH
This class represents the screen that shows up after a King of the Hill game ends, displaying the scores of each player, as well as who won.
RoomChooser
 
Screen
Represents a screen that shows up on the GUI when the program runs.
ScreenSwitcher
This interface represents the ability to switch screens.
Shotgun
This class represents a Shotgun.
Sniper
This class represents a Sniper.
Submachine
This class represents a Submachine gun.
Tile
This class represents a Tile.
TileManager
This class represents the Tile Manager.
Weapon
This class represents a Weapon.
WeaponSelectionScreen
This class represents the screen where the player can select a weapon to begin the game with (shotgun, sniper, smg, or knife).
World
Represents the screen of the actual game.
